name: winesap
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of apple, common in the US, with dark red skin and a sour taste: You can eat Winesaps if you like a tart apple, but they're best used for cooking. Winesap apples are very juicy and their taste makes them ideal for making cider.
More examplesFewer examplesThey grow a mixture of Winesaps, Jonathans, and Galas in the orchard.We are a small independent cider maker using only locally grown Winesap apples.Winesaps keep for a very long time because they are late-season apples.
